writing_prompt: While chasing a notorious fugitive through London, Hermione Granger mistakes the Doctor for her target—his uncanny doppelganger—and quickly discovers that the wizarding world and the Time Lord's adventures might be more intertwined than she ever imagined.
story:
He's Not Barty!
By: SnarkyGranger1
“Where are you, Barty?” Hermione grumbled to herself. Ever since the Ministry destroyed the Dementors, the prisoners got their souls back and have been escaping Azkaban prison more readily. The Auror division has been busy hunting the escapees. “I followed his trail to here in Southwark part of London.”  She catches a glimpse of him running with a blonde woman. “Oh, great, someone I would need to obliviate.”
“BARTY! STOP!” The Doctor heard behind him but kept on running. “Barty Crouch Jr, stop in the name of Scotland Yard!” He glanced behind him and was surprised to see that the woman was looking at him.
“Wait, Rose, I think this woman is confused.” The two of them halted and turned around to face the young, bushy-haired woman. “Can I help you, miss?”
“Barty, don’t play coy with me and let the woman go!” Hermione commanded as she pulled out her wand and pointed it at them.
The Doctor was confused by the name. “But I am not this Barty fellow, miss?” He raised his eyebrow.
“I am PC Granger, and I have been hunting you, Barty.” Hermione huffed. “I followed your trail to here. Give up.”
“Madam, he isn’t who you think he is.” Rose shook her head. “He is the Doctor.”
Hermione’s eyes grew wide. “Bloody hell he is. Prove it.”
“Hmm…ever heard of Torchwood.” The Doctor inquired.
“No, should I have?” Hermione looked puzzled.
“Hmm.. this is going to be tougher to prove.” The Doctor tilted his head back.
Rose looked behind Hermione and saw a man who looked almost like a carbon copy of the Doctor. “Miss, is that him behind you?”
Hermione twirled around and yelled, “Stupefy! Incarcerous!”
She caught Barty Crouch, Jr, unawares and was able to capture him before he could disappear again.
She turned back around and saw the surprised looks on their faces. “Listen, do I need to remove the scene from your head?”
“No, but does that mean you are an auror for the magical world?” The Doctor questioned her.
“Yes, I am. You do know the magical world?” Hermione looked at him with a shocked look.
“I do, and I am surprised that I have a doppelganger wizard.” The Doctor slowly approached the body. “I can see now why you thought that I was him.”
“Yes, sorry about that.” Hermione looked contrite. “I have been hunting him and his ilk for days now.” Hermione sighed as she stood him up. She smirked at his shocked look. “I think I took him by surprise, or he was surprised to see you, Doctor.”
“Probably the latter,” The Doctor laughed. “I have that issue sometimes.”
“Well, I need to transport him back to the Azkaban prison, but we need to figure out a better system since we got rid of the Dementors.” Hermione groaned.
“Those things are vile.” The Doctor looked at her in surprise. “Where are they now?”
“We destroyed them somehow because all the lost souls returned to the prisoners,” Hermione explained. “I should let you both go on to whatever you two were doing.”
“It’s alright, PC Granger. I live not far from here.” Rose pointed to a tall building. “We were just about to go on another adventure.”
“Have fun.” Hermione slapped a portkey on Barty before turning it on. “Goodbye!” They disappeared.
“Well, now, that was weird.” Rose looked at her Doctor.
“It was strange to see someone look identical to you even if they are human.” The Doctor laughed. “Let’s go!”  They ran to the TARDIS.

writing_prompt: When Hermione Granger stumbles upon a quaint mystery bookstore in Louisiana, she meets Velma Dinkley, a fellow book lover with a knack for solving puzzles. What begins as a search for a rare first edition turns into the start of an unexpected and enduring friendship.
story:
Hermione’s Search
By: SnarkyGranger1
Hermione Granger was travelling in the southern part of the United States when she came upon a mystery bookstore in North Vercherie, Louisiana. “Dinkley’s Mystery Shoppe.” She read the sign. “That sounds promising.” Hermione walked into the store, setting off the little bell above the door.
“Hello, welcome to Mystery Inc.’s Bookstore.” A woman of average height, wearing a baggy orange sweater with a pleated red skirt, knee socks and Mary Jane shoes. She had on square glasses, which was a change from Harry’s round ones.
“Hi, I am looking for a particular mystery book.” Hermione smiled at the woman.
“You came to the right place.” The woman beamed. “My name is Velma Dinkley, the owner of this place.”
“Hi, Velma. I am Hermione Granger.” They shook hands. “I have been travelling the country for two weeks on vacation to find this book and haven’t had much luck.”
“Which book are you searching for?” Velma moved around the counter to help her. “Are you British?”
“Yes, I am.” Hermione smiled. “I have been collecting Agatha Christie books and trying to buy their first editions if possible.”
“Oh, I have one or two of her books, but I am not positive that they are first.” Velma walked towards the back of the store. “I keep my rare editions back here along this wall. It helps me keep an eye on them.” She pointed to a hidden video camera.
“Smart idea, Velma.”Hermione praised her as Velma opened a caged door. “The book that I am looking for is ‘The Thirteen Problems’.”
“Oh, Miss Marple’s first appearance.” Velma perked up as she removed a book from the shelf and opened the book to see the copyright. “It says nineteen twenty-seven.”
Hermione beamed at Velma. “That’s it. That’s the first edition. I can’t believe you have it.”
“I’m actually surprised no one wanted this sooner because Miss Marple is a fan favourite of Christie’s works.” Velma closed the gate. “Is there anything else?”
“I don’t know, and you tell me what the other book is that you thought might be a first edition.” Hermione quirked her eyebrow.
“Oh, yes. Let’s see.” Velma reopened the gate, ran her fingers along the spine, and pilfered the book off the shelf. “Here we go, Hermione!” Velma handed her a book.
Hermione took it, and her eyebrow rose at the title. “Murder in the Calais Coach?” Hermione tilted her head as she thought about it. “Wait, is this the American version, and it had a different name for the first edition?”
“Yes, very good. I was curious to see if you did your research.” Velma broadly smiled. “Well done.”
“Thank you, and I was the research queen in school,” Hermione smirked.
“I was, too!” Velma grinned. “It drove everyone in my group crazy.”
“Mine, too!” Hermione shook her head. “I’ll take these and want to know if you want to go for coffee?”
“Coffee sounds good right now.” Velma took the two books to the counter and rang them up for Hermione. “How will you be paying?”
“Credit card, please.” Hermione pulled at her black Gringotts card that had a British bank name on it. “It will take me a few paychecks, but it’ll be worth it.”
“Jinkies!” Velma swiped the card and had her sign the slip before putting it under the till drawer. “Let me lock the drawer up in the back, and we can go down the street for good coffee.”
“Do you want me to step out?” Hermione pointed to the door.
“No, I trust you.” Velma took the cash drawer, went into the office, and locked it into the safe. She locked the door to the office and met her by the main door. “Let’s go!”
When they exited the store, Velma flipped the sign and locked the door. “I am ready for a break anyway.”
“Oh, that’s good.” Hermione smiled. “Which way?”
“This way to a local coffee shop. They brew the best coffee and doughnuts in the area.” Velma steered her to the left.
“Brilliant.” Hermione smiled as they walked down the street. It was the start of their friendship that lasted for years to come.
Velma was so happy to find a kindred spirit to share her favourite books.

writing_prompt: When Arthur Weasley discovers the secret behind his sons' new joke shop, he must decide how to support their dream while keeping the truth hidden from Molly—and the rest of the wizarding world.
story:
“Hey, Arthur, this came across my desk.” Kingsley came into the Misuse of Muggle Artefacts office.
“Hello, Kings; what do we have here?” Arthur took the paper from him. “Oh, the twins were serious about this joke business.”
“Is that what the business is going to be?” Kingsley inquired.
“Yes, they have only been talking about it for ages despite Molly’s objections.” Arthur rose from his seat. “I’m going to visit them at the shoppe.”
“I need that back for filing.” Kingsley retrieved the paperwork of the sold property on Diagon Alley. “They even bought the apartment above the shoppe.”
“Oh.” Arthur paused momentarily. “Probably most wise since Molly will be upset with them.”
“Right.” Kingsley dipped his head. “I’ll let you go and tell them good luck.”
“Thank you.” Arthur left the office and rode down to the Atrium, apparated to the Gringotts and walked over towards the twins’ shoppe. “They always liked wild colours.” He shook his head at the outside before stepping in. “Hello, boys.”
“DAD!” Fred and George ran over and hugged him. “What do you think?”
“It’s brilliant, but your Mother won’t agree.” Arthur sighed.
“But, Dad, this is our dream,” Fred replied.
“Yes, I know.” Arthur dipped his head. “but you let me worry about her.”
“Thank you.” George beamed at him.
“One question, please.” Arthur looked at both of his sons.
“Yes?” They looked at their Father nervously.
“As Head of House, I feel I need to ask this.” Arthur straightened his shoulders.
“Yes, Father?” George urged him on.
“Where did you get this money?” Arthur questioned them. “Did Bagman finally pay you for his debt?”
“No, he didn’t, but,” Fred spat out as he raised his hand to halt the next question. “Harry Potter gave us his winnings from the Triwizard Tournament.”
“He did?” Arthur was surprised to hear this. “Why?”
“Let me, Fred.” George took over. “Harry said that we are going into a war and we will need something to enlighten us during the hard times. He wants it to be kept quiet.”
“Oh, so, he’s a silent partner in a way,” Arthur muttered. “Definitely NOT telling your Mother that bit.”
“Yes, we wish she didn’t follow Rita so much because what she writes about our fellow students is horrible.” Fred shook his head.
“Yes, Hermione got some hate mail last year during the tournament.” George jerked his head.
“She did.” Arthur was shocked at the news. “Oh dear.” Arthur’s face went serious. “Listen to me both.”
“Yes, Father?” The twins chorused.
“Listen to Harry Potter and make something out of this and follow your dreams.” Arthur gave them his full blessing. “I love you both.”
The twins engulfed him in a hug. “We love you, Father.”
“Please be careful.” Arthur gave them a warning.
“We will, Father.” George replied, “Plus, we have some tricks up our sleeve that might help the Order.”
“Alright, see you soon.” Arthur waved before he exited the store.
“YES!” The twins high-fived each other before getting back to work and getting the shoppe in order.

writing_prompt: When George Weasley surprises his children, Freddie and Roxanne, with the keys to a new branch of Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes in Hogsmeade, the siblings must figure out how to make the shop their own while living up to their father's legacy.
story:
“Roxanne, Dad wants us to meet him at Hogsmeade on the next visit.” Freddie read the message from their family owl.
“Really? Did he say why?” Roxanne asked.
“No. Just meet him at the Three Broomsticks.” Freddie flipped it over, and nothing was on the back. “I guess we’ll find out.”
That weekend, Freddie and Roxanne walked into the pub together and saw their Dad. He waved them over to the booth. George got up and hugged them both. “Hello, kids. How are you doing?”
“We are good, Dad, but we are confused as to why you want to see us?” Roxanne inquired.
“What? I can’t see my kids because I miss them?” George smirked.
“Dad, we left you a month ago.” Freddie rolled his eyes.
“Have some Butterbeer, and I will show you why I wanted to see you both.” George poured them both a drink from a pitcher.
“Okay, I have been studying for the NEWTS; I think Aunt Hermione would be proud,” Freddie replied.
George just stared at him in shock. “Who are you, and what have you done with my son?”
“Nothing; I just want to pass these final exams so I can help you with your business.” Freddie defended himself.
“Excellent!” George rubbed his hands. “What about you, Roxie?”
“I’m studying my OWLs, but not as hard as Freddie here.” She thumbed her brother.
“Don’t let your Mother hear that.” George chuckled as he noticed that they were done with their drinks. “Are we ready, Freddie?”
“Dad!” Freddie rolled his eyes, “Let’s go!”
They all walked out of the pub, and George steered them towards the abandoned Zonko’s Shoppe.
“Here, Freddie.” George handed him a set of keys. “Go on.”
“Dad?” Fred looked confused as he opened the door.
“Welcome, Freddie, to our newest branch of WWW.” George cheered. “You are to run it once you graduate from Hogwarts, and Roxanne can help you during school breaks.”
“REALLY?” Freddie perked up. “My shoppe!”
“Yes, son, I have watched you over the years absorbing the information on my baby, and you have earned the right to do this too.”
“Thank you!” Freddie engulfed him in a hug. “I love you, Dad.”
“I love you, too, Freddie,” George muttered. “Come here, Roxanne.” He pulled her into the hug as well. “Love you both.”
“Does that mean I can decorate it any way I want?” Freddie perked up.
“Yes and no. You have to find something that is you and not house colours.” George replied. “We can’t show preference in a business.”
“Alright, Dad!” Freddie flicked his wand and cleared the place of all the cobwebs and dust. He flicked it again and painted the walls bright orange, making them all groan at the brightness. “Just kidding.” The final flick turned each wall a shade of the four houses of Hogwarts. “Now, House Unity.”
“Brilliant son!” George clapped his shoulder. “We will officially open the first Hogsmeade visit next school year.
“Sweet.” Freddie beamed. “I promise to do you right.”
“I know you will, both of you.” George grinned. “Now go! Have fun!”
“See you when we get home!” Freddie hugged him and gave him the key to lock up.
“Thank you, Dad. You made his year.” Roxanne smiled at her father.
“You are welcome, my girl.” George ushered her out the door. “Go study.”
“Love you!” Dominique ran out the door and grabbed more quills before going back to school.

writing_prompt: A magical family tradition involves gifting a single enchanted hair to create a newborn's wand, but when a precocious child takes the task a bit too literally, chaos and laughter ensue.
story:
“FLEUR!” Apolline yelled out. “Can you come here, please?”
“Oui, Mere!” Fleur ran into her mother’s study to find her sitting by the fire. “D’accord?”
“Si, but I need you to practice your English.” Apolline lightly reprimanded her. “We are going on vacation soon.”
“Okay, Mama.” Fleur sat next to her. “I missed you earlier. Did you go somewhere?”
“Yes, I went to see a healer.” Fleur gasped and turned to her mother. “I’m fine, my darling.” She patted her daughter’s hand. “I have a question for you.”
“Si?” Apolline gave her a slight glare. “Sorry, Yes, Mama.”
“How would you like to be a big sister?” Apolline smiled down at her nine-year-old.
“Really?” Fleur perked up in her seat. Apolline nodded. “OUI!!”
Appoline laughed at her reaction. “I have a special request for you.”
“Anything!” Fleur appeared bright-eyed with glee.
“I want you to ask Grand-mere this weekend if she would be willing to give up another hair for a wand.”
“Really?” Fleur clapped excitedly. “He or she can have a wand like mine.”
“That’s right, my darling.” Apolline caressed her cheek. “Go get ready.” Fleur dashed out of the room.
Twelve years later, Fleur smiled at the memory and was ready to do it with Victoire as well. “Victoire!”
“Oui, Maman.” Victoire toddled into the room. She was a precocious two-and-a-half-year-old with long silver-blonde hair like her Mama.
“Up you go,” Fleur put her on her lap, “I have news for you, my little one.”
“I hope it’s good.” Victoire appeared up shyly.
“Yes, it’s great news for us.” Fleur tickled her belly. “How would you like to be a big sister like I was to your Auntie Gabby?”
“Really?” Victoire’s eyes widened. Fleur beamed. “YEAH!!”
Fleur laughed out loud. “Okay, I need you to ask Grand-mere if she would be willing to donate a piece of hair for her new grand-enfant.”
“Okay. When are we going to see her?” The child bounced up and down in her lap.
“As soon as you get ready.” Fleur carefully put her child down before she waddled out of the room. Fleur rose from her seat and wrapped a shawl around her shoulders.
Victoire ran back into the room, all bundled up with a coat, scarf, hat and mittens, “All ready, Mama.”
Fleur snickered before bending down, “Do we need all this? I was going to pop us over?”
“Yes, what if we go outside?” Victoire nodded.
“We aren’t because it’s too cold.” Fleur shook her head. She took the outerwear off her little one. “Alright, Victoire, hold on.” Fleur picked her up as the child wrapped her arms and legs around her. “Good girl.”
Fleur apparated them both to the Delacour Manor in France. “MERE!”
“Fleur!” Apolline walked in, “And Victoire!” She pulled the child out of her daughter’s arms to hug her. “What did I do to deserve a visit?”
Victoire looked over to her mother, who dipped her head. “This, Grand-mere!” Victoire pulled a hair from Apolline.
“VICTOIRE!” Fleur admonished her. “That’s not what I meant.”
“It’s not?” Victoire’s face fell. “You said we needed one of her hairs.”
“What?” Apolline looked at the child in her arms to her child. “What is Victoire talking about?”
Fleur sighed. “Maman, Victoire was supposed to ask you if you would be willing to give up another hair like my grand-mere did when Gabrielle was born.”
Apolline’s eyes widened. “Are you really?”
“Yes, Mere!” Fleur beamed at her mother.
“YES!” Apolline bounced Victoire on her hip. “We are going to have another grand-enfant!”
“YEAH!” Victoire looked at the happy faces and asked. “I can smile now?”
“Si. Cheer!” Apolline kissed her all over the face to get her giggling again. “I love you!”
“We love you too, Mere!” Fleur kissed her cheek. Victoire gave her a wet kiss on the other side.
“I’m happy to have a brother or sister!” Victoire clapped.
“Good; let’s get a snack before I send you two home.” Apolline and Fleur walked out of the family den.

writing_prompt: The Doctor takes Luna Lovegood on a journey through time and space to help her heal after the war, but their next destination—a planet of endless wonders—holds a secret that neither of them is prepared for.
story:
The Doctor was laying on the bed in the TARDIS, staring down at her lover, Luna. They met during a time when Luna needed someone. The wizarding war had just ended, and she was angry at her father for his behaviour during it. So, the Doctor whisked her away.
Luna rolled over and cuddled into the Doctor’s body. “Mmm, my cuddly teddy,” Luna mumbled in her sleep.
The Doctor quietly chuckled at Luna as she tightened her arms around her. She noticed that Luna felt chilled, so she moved her hands up to help warm her up. The Doctor realized that she needed to keep her love warm. She will need to fix the heat on the TARDIS later.
Luna burrowed herself into the Doctor’s body and threw a leg over hers. “I love you.”
“I know, and you know it as well.” The Doctor kissed her forehead. “Are you warm enough?”
Luna happily sighed as she snuggled even more into the Doctor. “Yes, you are my snuggle bug.”
“I should fix the TARDIS.” The Doctor tried to move, but Luna wouldn’t let her up.
“No, you aren’t going anywhere, my love.” Luna tightened her arms around the Doctor’s waist.
“Alright, my moon.” She settled more into the bed, shifting Luna slightly before pulling the sheets up around her. “Warm?”
“Yes,” Luna kissed her neck. “I’m so glad that you took me away from England for a while.”
“I am too, Luna.” The Doctor kissed her head. “You helped me get through some things from my past.”
“You are welcome, my love.” Luna burrowed. “I know I need to go back sometime and help them recover from this war, but I just needed a getaway before I threw a wobble at my father and made it into a kerfuffle.”
“Yes, you do need to return eventually, but that’s the great thing about this glorious machine: we can come back at the same time you left or a couple of days later if you want.” The Doctor rubbed Luna’s back, “but we don’t have to talk about it right now.”
“Mmm…brilliant idea about coming back a day or two later so I won’t be tempted to try to change something within the final battle.” Luna snuggled into her breasts. “I love how warm and comfy you are.”
“Thank you.” The Doctor gently squeezed her arms around Luna. “Once I fix the TARDIS, I am going to take you to someplace fun before we go back to Earth.”
“With animals?” Luna’s voice sounded hopeful.
“We can go to a planet full of animals.” The Doctor murmured. “I’ll ask TARDIS where it is.”
“Okay, or a place full of books.” Luna noticed that the Doctor froze. “What?” Luna looked up into her eyes.
“No Library, please.” The Doctor begged.
“OI!” Luna shifted her body to stare into the Doctor’s eyes more. “I’m never going to force you to go back to a place that was a bad memory. My friend, Hermione, would be disappointed, but I will never force you.”
The Doctor relaxed once again. “Thank you, my moon.” The Doctor kissed her lips sweetly.
“Of course, my love.” Luna caressed her cheek before laying her head down on her chest. “Love our snuggling time.”
“Me, too. Let’s get some sleep. In the morning, we’ll fix the TARDIS.” The Doctor shifted Luna to her side so she could spoon her.
“Good night, my love.” Luna tilted her head to get a kiss from the Doctor.
“Good night, my moon.” The Doctor kissed her forehead before tucking the sheets around them. She enjoyed having Luna in her arms as she rested for the night.

writing_prompt: When Hermione receives a letter from her parents criticizing her for magically altering her teeth, she must decide how to navigate their disapproval while keeping the truth about the spell that caused it a secret.
story:
Hermione was sitting in the Great Hall having breakfast when a school owl came down in front of her, leg up. “Oh! For me?” The owl bobbed her head. Hermione quickly untied the paper and gave the owl a piece of bacon. “Thank you.”
The owl took its treat and flew off back to the Owlery to rest.
Hermione was happily surprised to find a letter from her parents. “I wonder if it’s their Easter card since I won’t be able to get back home for it.” She ripped the envelope open with a huge smile. As she started to read it, it slowly slipped off.
“Shite!” She crumbled it up and threw it as she ran out of the Great Room with her friends calling her name.
“Miss Weasley, where is Miss Granger running off to?” Professor McGonagall approached the table.
“I don’t know, but I think it has something to do with this?” Ginny held up a crumbled-up paper. “It came from her parents.”
“Oh dear. Give it to me, and I’ll check on Miss Granger.” The professor took the missive from the young girl. “Thank you. Mister Potter, any idea where she might be?”
“Try the library; if not, the girl's bathroom.” Harry shrugged.
“Library would be my best bet, professor,” Ginny replied. “She has taken solitude there more after her first year.”
“Right.” Professor McGonagall walked up and into the library. Madam Pince pointed to the back. “Thank you.”
“Sure, she was crying as she ran by.” Irma dipped her head. “I’ll try to keep the others away until you are done.”
“Thank you.” Minerva dipped her head. She walked deep into the library and followed the crying sounds of the young girl. When Minerva rounded the shelving, she found Hermione curled up in her chair with tears running down her face. “Oh, Miss Granger.”
“Professor McGonagall, I wasn’t expecting you.” Hermione tried to wipe off her tears angrily. “What do you need? Help with something?”
“No, my dear child.” Minerva sat down next to Hermione and patted her hand. “I saw you run out of the hall and wanted to check on you.”
“I’ll be fine. I should have realised that they would have noticed the change.” Hermione sighed.
“Your parents?”
“Yes. They sent me a letter scolding me about reducing my teeth to normal size.” Hermione started to cry again.
“Oh dear.” Minerva rubbed her back to comfort her. “I don’t understand. Don’t they work with teeth?”
“Yes, they do, but they said that I should be happy with how they looked instead of trying to get them fixed,” Hermione grumbled. “When I got hit with that spell, I took advantage of allowing Madame Pomfrey to shrink it a bit smaller.”
Minerva nodded.
“I sent them a picture of Viktor and me that Colin took during the Yule Ball, and of course, instead of telling me how beautiful I looked, they berated me for my teeth.”
“Don’t they know about the spell hitting them?” Minerva asked. Hermione shook her head. “Why not?”
“Because they would have taken me out of here.” Hermione looked up at her pleadingly. “They are still threatening it in the letter.”
“Do you want me to send your parents a letter explaining what happened?” The professor inquired.
“No, I will talk to them after the year is through.” Hermione sighed.
“If you run into problems, please message me, and I will come to help.” Minerva patted her hand.
“Thank you, Professor McGonagall.” Hermione smiled.
“You are welcome, Miss Granger. Let’s get you something to eat before classes start.” Minerva stood up.
“Good idea. One piece of toast isn’t enough for my learning fuel.” Hermione rose and pushed her chair in. “Thank you for checking on me, professor.”
“I need to prepare for my first class. Please eat.” Minerva and Hermione split ways at the staircase.
“See you later, professor.” Hermione waved as she went down the stairs to find Harry waiting with a small stack of toast as she had done for him. “Thanks, Harry.” Hermione beamed.
“Better?” Harry sounds concerned.
“Yes, the letter upset me, but I’ll be fine.” Hermione took a bite.
“Good.” Harry flashed her a smile as they walked out the door for the Care for Magical Creatures class.

writing_prompt: When Hagrid calls on Luna Lovegood to assist with a unicorn's difficult birth, she finds herself navigating both magical challenges and the deep bond she shares with the creatures of the Forbidden Forest. What unexpected surprises await her after the task is done?
story:
Luna received an owl from Hagrid from Hogwarts.
Luna,
I need help with the unicorns. They are birthing.
Hagrid
“Ms. Owl, please let him know that I’ll be right there.” Luna let the owl out before grabbing another parchment to write to Hermione and Ginny.
My Loves,
I have to go to Hogwarts because the unicorns are birthing, and Hagrid needs my help. I will see you later tonight.
Love you both, Luna.
Luna grabbed her medical bag, popped into the Hogwarts gate and let herself in. She hurried to the Forbidden Forest and found Hagrid near the entrance, looking nervous.
“Good yeh are here. She almost ready ter birth it an' I can' touch it.” Hagrid hurried into the forest to the first clearing just beyond the entrance.
“I’m ready, Hagrid. Just let me roll my sleeves up.” Luna stripped off her jacket and rolled up her sleeves as she surveyed the unicorn in front of her. She noticed that the mare was panting. “Oh dear.” Luna knelt down and gently patted the unicorn’s belly and felt the problem. “Merlin, this one is breached. I’m going to have to put my hands in to help turn the foal inside.”
Luna slipped off her rings and put them into her safe pocket before murmuring to the panting unicorn, “It’s going to be okay. Let me help you.”
The unicorn looked at Luna and saw that she was the one that visited in the past. She grunted at the witch.
“Alright, here I come.” Luna carefully placed her hands into the birthing canal and felt for the hooves of the foal. She carefully pulled them into the foal’s body so she could gently turn the baby around.
The mama unicorn sighed as the pain slowly subsided. She nodded to the witch to continue.
“Okay, I am going to help guide your foal out.” Luna took a deep breath and carefully inched the foal out.
“I see the head!” Hagrid exclaimed.
“I need to get the shoulders out before this baby can slip itself out easily.” Luna groaned as she tightened her grip to pull the shoulders past the canal, and it finally glided out of mama. “Beautiful golden baby.”
Mama unicorn made a noise, catching Luna’s attention.
“Oh, yes, we need to make sure she passes the placenta and gives it to our potions mistress.” Luna laid a clean bag down and opened it just in time. The placenta slipped into the open bag, and Luna tied it up and placed it near her own. “Let’s get this foal to her to clean her off.”
Luna carefully placed the foal near its mama, and she started to lick the baby clean. The foal’s coat started to shine brightly. “Beautiful.”
“Thank yeh, luna.” Hagrid jovially praised her. “Are yeh goin' ter take tha' bag ter the castle?”
“No, you can do the honours, Hagrid.” Luna rose from her knees and took a towel from Hagrid. “Thank you.” She wiped herself clean. “She should be fine now.” Luna picked up the bag and knotted it. “Give this to Professor Malfoy. Tell him that Luna birthed it, and it wasn’t tampered with.”
“Okay, thank yeh again.” Hagrid took the bag and watched Luna leave the forest to go home.
Luna sighed as she walked into her house with her wives. “I’m home.”
“Luna!” Hermione and Ginny came running in and gave her big kisses.
“How was it?” Hermione was curious.
“It was slightly difficult because it was breached.” Luna sighed. “But I was able to turn it and birth it too. I made sure the placenta was out and sealed it into a bag for Hagrid to bring to the Potions Master. I am beaten and starving.”
“We have food for you in the bedroom. Go take a quick shower and meet us in there.” Ginny kissed her softly.
“Alright. Love you both.”
“We love you too.”
Luna disappeared into the loo.
“She is so lucky to do that,” Ginny remarked to Hermione as they walked into their bedroom.
“Yes, and let’s set this up for her,” Hermione smirked as she picked up some edible undies.
“Let’s.” Ginny grinned back as she grabbed her own.
Luna had a lovely surprise waiting for her when she joined them.

writing_prompt: When Hermione returns to Hogwarts to finish her studies, a late-night visit from Lavender Brown’s ghost forces her to confront old guilt and take on an unexpected favor.
story:
“I’m so glad that I asked Harry for Marauder’s Map before I came back here,” Hermione mumbled to herself as she searched for it in her trunk. “Honestly!” Hermione stomped her foot. “Accio Map!”
The map slapped her hand, and she slammed the trunk shut. Hermione opened the map and tapped it with her wand. “I solemnly swear I am up to no good.” The map slowly appeared on the blank paper. Hermione started to search for a particular person. She almost couldn’t find her. Hermione’s eyes widened when she realised that the person was right outside her room. She dashed to the portrait and opened it.
“Lavender!”
“Hermione!”
“Please come in.”
Lavender floated into the room and looked around. “Nice room, Hermione.”
“Thank you.” Hermione tapped the paper again. “Mischief Managed.”
“What’s that?”
“It’s how Harry, Ron and I managed to stay out of trouble most of the time.” Hermione shook her head.
“Ah. I kept seeing Harry looking at it at times.” Lavender nodded. “Even Ron was playing with it when we were dating.”
“Oh?” Hermione looked up at her, expression changing. “I’m sorry.”
“What?” Lavender looked confused.
“I said that I’m sorry, Lavender. I failed you.”
“Hermione, you didn’t fail me.”  Lavender shook her head. “It’s not your fault that I died.”
“But I got that werewolf off of you. I should have made sure that you got help before I dashed away.”
“Listen, Hermione, I’m not mad at you. You were in a tough situation, and I imagine you were going somewhere specific before you helped me.”
“Yes, I was, but it still doesn’t excuse me from actually saving you from bleeding to death.” Hermione slumped on the bed.
“Rubbish.”
Hermione looked up in surprise.
“There were plenty of other people around, Hermione, who could have helped, including one of our professors.” Lavender expounded as she stepped closer to her. “I want to thank you, though.”
“What?! Why?” Hermione’s voice raised.
“Because you did momentarily help me, just enough to get him off of me and allowed me to die in peace amongst the rubble.” Lavender went to move Hermione’s hair and forgot that she couldn’t.
Hermione shivered at Lavender’s cold hand going through her. “I always forget how cold ghosts are.” Then she looked up. “Are ghosts cold?”
“I might feel cold to you, but we really aren’t.” Lavender shook her head. “Please, Hermione, don’t feel guilty. If I had survived, I would have felt like I owed you a life debt.”
“A lift debt?” Hermione tilted her head. “I didn’t think those still existed anymore.”
“They do, and I would like you to do me a favour, please.” Lavender looked hopeful.
“Anything?” Hermione sat up straight.
“Can you please go see Parvati and make sure that she’s okay?” Lavender sagged. “I miss my best friend, and I know she probably misses me, too.”
“Yes, I will. When we have the next break, I’ll go and visit her and Padma. Neither of them came back this year. Actually, not many did.”
“I wonder if they went to a different school to finish.” Lavender pondered.
“Oh, that’s possible, and I didn’t go that route because I wanted to finish here where I started.” Hermione dipped her head.
“Good for you, Hermione!” Lavender smiled at her. “Go and show this magical world what you are made of!”
“Thank you, Lavender.” Hermione beamed at her. “I’ll let you out unless you want to go through the door.”
“Open it, please?” When Lavender replied, there was a knock on the portrait. “Oh, someone is here.”
Hermione went over and opened it, and it revealed Ginny and Luna. “Hey, girls, come in.”
Ginny and Luna came in and stopped when they saw Lavender. “Hey, Lavender. Are we interrupting something?”
“No, it was perfect timing because I have to go.” Lavender floated closer to the portrait and waited for Hermione to open it. “Thank you.”
“Anytime. I’ll let you know if I hear anything.” Hermione smiled at her lost dormmate. “Good night.”
Lavender floated out, and Hermione shut it.
“What was that about?” Ginny asked.
“Oh, just clearing some air between us, and she asked me a small favour, which I’ll do later.” Hermione grinned at her two friends. “So, what are we doing tonight?”
Luna and Ginny started talking about some ideas that they had as Hermione listened.
Thank you, Lavender, for soothing my mind.

writing_prompt: After escaping a harrowing ordeal, Hermione struggles to find safety in the arms of her friends, but the scars of her experience run deep, and healing proves to be as much about trust as it is about time.
story:
Hermione felt herself disappear from the Malfoy Manor and ended up on the ground somewhere near the water.
“Hermione!” She heard Harry yell for her as he scrambled to her.
“NO! GET AWAY FROM ME!” Hermione screeched as she batted him away.
“It’s me, Harry.” He tried again but to no avail.
“ ’arry?” Fleur softly called out to him. “Are you okay?”
“I’m fine, but Hermione isn’t. Can you help her? She won’t let us near her.” Harry looked up at the blonde witch.
“Certainly,” Fleur carefully stepped forward, “Please move, ‘arry.”
Harry moved out of the way along with Dobby’s body. “Bellatrix tortured her.”
Fleur gasped at the news as she ran a diagnostic spell over her. “She has some bleeding on her arm, and it’s going to take time for her to recover from this.”
“Bleeding?” Harry glanced over.
“I’m bleeding?” Hermione started to itch her arm. “Get this off me.” She started to rock.
Fleur carefully laid her hand on her shoulder. “It’s me, Fleur, mon ami.”
Hermione felt something warm on her shoulder and turned her head. She burst into tears at the sight of Fleur. “Help me.”
“I will. Let me bring you up to the house.” Fleur stood up and held out her hand to help her up.
Hermione tried to get up but collapsed into Fleur’s body due to her weakened state. “Bloody hell.”
“I got you.” Fleur swept her up into her arms and held her lightly so she wouldn’t feel trapped. “I am going to take you to the bedroom so you can have the comfy bed.” Fleur swiftly walked into the cottage. “Bill, I need the med box and everyone out of the bedroom.”
“Got it, Fleur.” Bill ran into the kitchen to get the box and yelled, “Ronald, get back down here.”
“But-” Ron tried to object.
“Ron, Hermione needs tending to, and Fleur needs privacy in order to do it.” Bill used his big brother's voice. “Stay down here.” Bill started to go up when he noticed Luna nursing her arm. “Luna, this way.”
“Shut it, Ron.” Harry snarled when he saw him open his mouth.
Luna scrambled up the stairs and joined the other three. “Yes, Bill?”
“Let me look at your arm while Fleur is bandaging Hermione up.” Bill patted the bed.
“Okay.” Luna hopped up.
Bill and Fleur worked in tandem, giving aid to the two ladies.
“Alright, Hermione, slip into bed and Luna next to her, please,” Fleur spoke firmly. “Hermione, I want Luna with you because I have a feeling there’s going to be nightmares and aftershocks ahead.”
“Okay.” Hermione threw off the heavy covers. “Just the sheet, please.” Hermione tried to get comfortable as Luna slipped in on the other side.
“Hermione, let me hold you. It took Dean to hold me to stop the shaking when I was in the dungeons.” Luna softly encouraged her by opening her arms.
Hermione debated it for a moment but decided to see if she felt safe with her. She carefully slid into her arms. Luna held her loosely. Hermione sighed at the warm cocoon.
Fleur covered them both with a sheet before ushering her husband out. “Call me if you need anything.”
“I think you will know.” Luna sadly whispered.
“D’accord.” Fleur left with the door ajar.
“Try to sleep, Hermione, while you can.” Luna placed Hermione’s head on her shoulder. “I’ve got you.”
“Okay.” Hermione sighed as she tried to stop twitching into a fitful sleep.
Luna started to sing her lullaby, and she felt Hermione calm and go into a more restful sleep. She stayed up that night to watch over her.
